comment: She was wonderful. Always willing to work with me and meet to go over upcoming labs. So sweet and caring. Love her !
Professor Kossoff was amazing!!! We had an online lab which can be a little much but she made all the content very accessible and answers emails very quickly if you have any concerns.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Very knowledgeable! Her assignments are straightforward! She is very open to helping others and is willing to discuss your work. She provides examples of what she wants. Be ready to work in groups with others, as projects are submitted as groups. Overall, great teacher!

I took her for BIOL 1108L, not sure why there isn't an option. Pretty chill online lab, but a lots work. Don't procrastinate like I did and you're golden. There's group work occasionally. REALLY read the instructions on the lab protocols, as there are prelab quizzes and the grading rubrics are pretty detailed but the grading itself is lenient.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Ms. Kossoff is a great teacher. Attendancy isn't mandatory, and you can pass all your tests and assignments as long as you do the study guide and study the lecture notes (she posts them.) There are in-class activities taken for a grade, so just show up for those.

Super nice, gives you everything you need to succeed in the class. Attendance isn't mandatory, but I liked going to the lectures to better understand material. HW questions and practice tests on Pearson are word-for-word questions on the test. If you do both of those, you'll do perfect.
She was amazing! all of her PowerPoint is uploaded, make sure you take advantage of the extra credit assignments, and make sure you fill in the study guide because it's very useful for the tests.

If you study the study guide, you are almost guaranteed a 100. The study guide is exactly like the tests, the labs are built in as quizzes and are very easy. Attendance isn't mandatory however if you can't teach yourself, I would suggest going to the lectures. Extremely extra credit heavy, extra credit options for each unit are available.

Dr. Kossoff is by far one of the most chill lab professors available for ecology lab. As long as you show up and do your work you shouldn't have any problems. Dr. Kossoff is so sweet and kind, she is always willing to answer any questions and is very helpful if you are struggling with the excel work.

I took Prof Kossoff in the summer for SCI 1101. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you can't make up missed activities/assessments unless your absence is excused. There are labs, but as long as you read through them, you should be fine, and you don't have to turn them in. Extra credit opportunities are abundant, and this prof is always here to help.

I just finished taking my summer course for Science 101 and I can say she's a great professor. It doesn't take much to pass the class just study lectures and pay attention. Easy A fr, p.s i hope she gets a raise.
Easy A i would say, her class slides are really everything that'll be on her test. Take her if you can

She was very sweet and she cared about her students. if you made a mistake on a lab report she would give you the opportunity to fix it. Never was i ever not able to get in touch with her she was very accessible too i would take her 10x again.

I believe it was her first semester at KSU and she was absolutely wonderful. Class was straightforward, I always showed but know some who showed up once and got A's, Lectures are very helpful and essentially have all the test material - posted them for review, no real work besides fairly easy tests and quizzes, extra credit, understanding, So kind.
She is a very kind instructor for lab. She is understanding, organized, and always there for you. I know she will do a great job in instructing future classes.
